content.description: start same as heel hooks but go up to large jug and continue straightup from there. crux is getting your feet up after grabbing high jug.
content.location: on the left side of the cave. same start as heel hooks. get down by walking off back side.

content.description: This is the sit start for the molar, crimpy holds and small feet.
sit start to block obama. adds some crazy moves. grade is a wild guess.

The is an awesome little one move wonder (maybe not so awesome if you're over 5'10") on the white mostly polished boulder that makes up the right side of the cave.  To the best of my knowledge this was found by Andrew Guice as he was waiting to get on another problem.   

  Starts at the small hold on the bottom point and consists of one lunge up with the left to the only decent hold on the rock, top out from there. 

  I've also seen it done by tossing yourself up on the boulder with a far left leg and flagging your way up.
content.protection: I think a spotter would be a good idea, not super exposed and you would be fine with only a pad as company.

content.description:
Start in same spot as you start Heelhooks, on the lower section of the angling ledge. Go right hand straight up to a crimp a little below the white crystal band. Choose from a few small intermediates for your left hand, then slap way out left to a sloping hold on the arete. Once you hit the sloper, bump your left up to a good hold a few inches higher. Get your feet up, then move with your right hand to a good hold at the apex of the arete. Move up and right to topout. Requires some unique body positioning and footwork, which makes it pretty fun. 

  Alternately, you can skip the arete, and from the small left hand intermediate, throw left hand to the good hold at the apex of the arete.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a spotter, the landing is kinda bad.
content.location: In the Cave area, starts as Heelhooks, but moves left.

content.description: This is a fun problem starting on the left side following the crack that goes up and to the right.  Start with two hands and work your way over, you end up bumping a right hand up then a dead point to the black ledge.
content.protection: Pads and at least one spotter.

content.description: Start on the prominent horn in cave, move out right and transition to the awkward offwidth between the Cave and "Molar" bloc.Â

This is on the boulder behind you when you're looking at Heal Hooks, nothing fancy but there have been summer nights when we all end up sitting in this area so we've found a lot of entertaining things.  In this case it's getting to the top of this boulder without using your hands.  Not super tough but good for working on balance and slightly entertaining when you're taking a break or resting your hands.

Stand start with a high right hand crimp, and a lower left hand crimp-flake. pulling off of the ground takes some muscle. jump to a slopey jug, and figure out the rest. Try avoiding the poorly glued foot for an added challenge!
down the wash from the roof on the left, one will be able to see an obvious blank roof with a few holds on it.
